post.description:
Create a meeting with name, description, address and date.
When you create a meeting you are the host
You id as a user is the meeting hostId.

get.description: List all meetings with id, name, description, address, date, hostId and  a participants list with some information such as: id, firstName, lastName, username, email

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Order  by id, name, description, date, location.country, location.state, location.city, location.street, location.number  (default id)

meetings.name: Test Meeting 2
meetings.description: This is my second Test Meeting

meetings.name: Test Meeting
meetings.description: This is my first Test Meeting

get.description:
List all meetings with id, name, description, address, date, createdAt, updatedAt and  a participants list with some information such as: id, firstName, lastName, username, email, isAdmin, createdAt, updatedAt.
And host information like: id, firstName, lastName, username, email, isAdmin, createdAt, updatedAt

meeting.name: Test Meeting
meeting.description: This is my first Test Meeting

put.description:
Update a meeting, name, description, address and date.
there are 2 rules in this endpoint:
1. Only the host user can update the meeting
2. Admin user can update the meeting without be the host

meeting.name: Test updated Meeting
meeting.description: This is my first Test Meeting

delete.description:
Delete a meeting.
there are 2 rules in this endpoint:
1. Only the host user can delete the meeting
2. Admin user can delete the meeting without be the host

post.description: Create a user with firstName, lastName, username, email, isAdmin (optional, default false) and password

get.description: List all user with id, firstName, lastName, username, email, and isAdmin

put.description: enroll one user in an event

delete.description: enroll one user in an event

tags.name: Meeting
tags.description:
This is the section for meetings, you can create, list, detail, update and delete meetings
you need a token for this sub section (you can go to public/login for one)
There are some rules that are depending of the specific endpoint, and they are mentioned in the certain endpoint

tags.name: user
tags.description:
This is the section for users, you can create, list, detail, update, enrole to meeting, leave a meeting and delete users
you need a token for this sub section (you can go to public/login for one)

There are some rules that are depending of the specific endpoint, and they are mentioned in the certain endpoint
